oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The asymptotic leading term for maximum rank of ternary forms of a given degree
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: De Paris, Alessandro
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Algebraic Geometry
Mathematics - Commutative Algebra
15A21, 15A69, 15A72, 14A25, 14N05, 14N15
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Let $\operatorname{r_{max}}(n,d)$ be the maximum Waring rank for the set of all homogeneous polynomials of degree $d>0$ in $n$ indeterminates with coefficients in an algebraically closed field of characteristic zero. To our knowledge, when $n,d\ge 3$, the value of $\operatorname{r_{max}}(n,d)$ is known only for $(n,d)=(3,3),(3,4),(3,5),(4,3)$. We prove that $\operatorname{r_{max}}(3,d)=d^2/4+O(d)$ as a consequence of the upper bound $\operatorname{r_{max}}(3,d)\le\left\lfloor\left(d^2+6d+1\right)/4\right\rfloor$.
Comment: v1: 10 pages. v2: extended introduction and some mistakes corrected
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Final version in Linear Algebra Appl. 500 (2016) 15--29
